gov.usgs.alarm

Class EventHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.alarm.EventHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class EventHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    EventHandler - accepts static declaration of events, creates event handlers for each instance of an event (this includes node and process). Each instance is a thread waiting for a doit() to fire off the processing of the event. When it fires, the full event processing is done dispatching e-mail, pages, etc per the other tables (subscription, schedule, alias).

      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      main test
      void run()
      process the event, find subscribers, send stuff to notification objects
      1) Find all of the subscribers for an event (by source or event code)
      2) For each subscriber :
      Check that the node and process regexp pass muster if present
      Do the event
      3) If no subscribers are found, process event using the source defaults (panic or emergency defaults)

      • declareEvent

        public static void declareEvent(Event evt)
        declareEvent either creates an event hander for this event, or it updates a reoccurance of this event to the handler via doit(). It is only through this static method that EventHandlers are created.
        Parameters:
        evt - The event to start an handler for

      • run

        public void run()
        process the event, find subscribers, send stuff to notification objects
        1) Find all of the subscribers for an event (by source or event code)
        2) For each subscriber :
        Check that the node and process regexp pass muster if present
        Do the event
        3) If no subscribers are found, process event using the source defaults (panic or emergency defaults)
